body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Places To Go             Places To Go          Visitor Center Complex Located on the ridge above the Memorial Plaza at the crash site, the Visitor Center Complex includes the Visitor Center with exhibit area, Learning Center, a parking area, Allée and Western Overlook trailheads, and the Flight Path Walkway and Overlook. Restrooms are located in the Learning Center and a bookstore is located in the Visitor Center.          Memorial Plaza at crash site The Memorial Plaza marks the edge of the crash site, which is the final resting place of the passengers and crew. It consists of various elements including the Wall of Names and is a self-guided experience. Interpretive panels provide an overview of the story and a cell phone/mobile tour provides for more in-depth exploration. There is a parking area and restrooms. Allée and Western Overlook trailheads are located here.          Memorial Groves, Allée, and Wetlands Bridge The 40 Memorial Groves, one for each of the passengers and crew, radiate along the Ring Road and Allée from the Visitor Center Complex to the Wetlands Bridge. The Allée, a formal walking path, follows the edge of the grove and connects the Visitor Center Complex and the Memorial Plaza, crossing the wetlands via the Wetlands Bridge.
title: Flight 93 National Memorial: Places To Go
